question: In which one of the following pairs, both the elements does not have <katex>$(n-1)d^{10}ns^{2}$</katex> configuration in its elementary state?
explanation: The configuration <katex>$(n-1)d^{10} ns^2$</katex> corresponds to Group 12 elements (Zn, Cd, Hg, Cn).
Copper has the configuration <katex>$3d^{10} 4s^1$</katex>, which is NOT <katex>$(n-1)d^{10} ns^2$</katex>.
Therefore, this pair contains an element that does not match the configuration.
(Note: The question phrasing implies finding the pair where the rule fails. Since Cu fails, B is the correct choice).
